page.title: 13Post Office at Kylesku
page.content: Unlike most regions in Britain we have to wait until 5 p.m. for our post to arrive. However the post mistress starts work before 9 a.m. Firstly, she prepares the mail for despatch. At nine o'clock she sets off with it in the Post Car to hand it over to the Lochinver Post Bus which she meets at the main road, seven miles away. She is back in Kylesku with the Post Office open for business at 10 a.m. Our Post Office must be one of the smallest, most photographed offices in the country _ an ex-garden shed. At 2 p.m. the post mistress sets off to collect our mail which has been brought from Lairg by the returning Post Bus. Her next task is sorting out the mail. This done, the mail is delivered to the fifty houses on the eighteen mile route and we can read our morning papers at tea time.
